CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 11, 1967, pg. 13, reads: "HONOREE'S TABLE - Mrs. Homer S. Brown is surrounded by her family and some of her friends here at the Awards Dinner-Dancer given at the Pick-Roosevelt Hotel recently. Pictured at the honoree's table clockwise are Mrs. Eunice Washington, Atty. Byrd Brown, son; the honoree, Mrs. Brown; her husband, Judge Homer S. Brown; Everette Utterback Jr. (standing) a nephew, Mrs. Roland Sawyer, Mrs. Lauretta McCallister, Mrs. Everette Utterback, Jr. (standing) Atty. Everette Utterback, Sr., brother-in-law, Mrs. Utterback, and Mrs. Katie E. Johnson."Accompanying article reads: "An overflow crowd packed the main ballroom of the Pick-Roosevelt Hotel recently when the Women's Auxiliary of the Pittsburgh Branch  NAACP sponsored its second annual "Daisy E. Lampkin Award" Dinner-Dance..."
TitMainTitle: Eunice Washington with curl over ear, Byrd Brown, Wilhelmina Byrd Brown, Homer S. Brown, Everett Utterback Jr., Aileen Eckstein Sawyer, Lauretta McCallister, Barbara Utterback, Everett Utterback Sr., Bernice Utterback, and Katie E. Johnson, gathered around banquet table at Women's Auxiliary of NAACP dinner dance, Roosevelt Hotel
